page.title: 07Landscape in Cheddleton Area
page.content: Standing on Crown Point, most of our 12km. lies before us. Green fields, trees, stone dividing walls and hedges make an intricate pattern. In the valley run the River Churnet and Caldon Canal. Dominating the hill above the river stands the Church of St. Edward the Confessor.This and the cluster of brick houses around it form the nucleus of the old village , newer housing estates spreading to the S&E. Two industrial sites, at Leekbrook and old Paper Mill are compact, blending with their surroundings. The water tower at St. Edwards Hospital is a well known local landmark. There is little ribbon development, The region is chiefly agricultural,sheep and cows graze peacefully in the fields.
